attributes.action: Allow People Who Wish To Smoke Access To Designated Smoking Pubs/Clubs/Areas In The Belief This Is An Infringement Of Civil Liberties
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The purpose of the petition is to recognise that in free and tolerant society individuals should have the right to continue to smoke a legal substance and socialise with like minded people in designated smoking pubs/clubs.

This petition raises wider concerns at the significant erosion of civil liberties.

This petition relates to protecting a way of life that people have pursued legally for centuries without being detrimental to non smokers. 
 
The petition recognises that both smokers and many non smokers are opposed to the blanket ban imposed in most indoor public areas and consider this to be a civil liberties issue. 
The petition acknowledges that the ban discriminates against a large minority of UK adults. 

The petition acknowledges by definition the rights also of non smokers to have equal rights to non smoking venues.

The smoking ban fails to accommodate the needs of smokers to continue to meet with others for recreation and social activities in a warm and sheltered public place.
 
The petition recognises an activity should not be banned if the risks associated with an activity does not effect others and is understood and accepted by the individual concerned.
